messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Quick Conference Check-in
messages.msgSnippet: 240 people went on the WHale Watches, and no one missed the boat! (There was, however, some vomiting. Let s see, take lots of kids from home, have them stay up
messages.messageBody:
240 people went on the WHale Watches, and no one missed the boat! (There
was, however, some vomiting. Let's see, take lots of kids from home, have
them stay up late and eat unfamiliar food and sleep in a strange place, then
at the end put them in a boat on the Atlantic. What WAS I thinking??!!)
However, we saw whales, and that was COOL!

I think people had a good time, and the hotel was very happy to have us.

Kathryn



*********************************************************************
Here's another one of those things that make you go "HUH": Take two kids
who are on a boat in the Atlantic after being in a strange place, eating
unfamiliar food and getting no sleep, who say they feel sick......THEN
listen to the advice of a well-meaning stranger who says it's not as "wavy"
upstairs, and send them up there. WHAT was I thinking?


Marjorie
P.S. Sorry to anyone who got splashed, and thanks to Erika for cleaning up
upstairs while I got them downstairs and resting, and thanks to the people
who brought them water and gum. In the confusion I don't even remember who
did what.

messages.subject: Re: Quick Conference Check-in

messages.messageBody:
> and the hotel was very happy to have us.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

This is great that we left them with a good impression of us. And,
yes, we did have fun.

Crystal

messages.subject: Quick Conference Check-in
messages.msgSnippet: I m still recovering a bit, so this won t be long, but I wanted to mention  a few quick things about the Live and Learn Conference in Peabody, MA. It was
messages.messageBody:
I'm still recovering a bit, so this won't be long, but I wanted to mention a
few quick things about the Live and Learn Conference in Peabody, MA.

It was amazing! Very cool people everywhere you looked -- 573 of them!!!!!!!

Lots of connections made, great speakers, a fun raffle (thanks to Kelly
Lovejoy), and relatively few glitches. I got to hang out with Barbara Sher!

240 people went on the WHale Watches, and no one missed the boat! (There
was, however, some vomiting. Let's see, take lots of kids from home, have them
stay up late and eat unfamiliar food and sleep in a strange place, then at the
end put them in a boat on the Atlantic. What WAS I thinking??!!) However,
we saw whales, and that was COOL!

I think people had a good time, and the hotel was very happy to have us.

Kathryn
